Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board extends Object
The chess board itself

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Board(int squareWidth, int startPointX, int startPointY)
    constructor, takes the squarewidth and the coordinates of startpoints to start drawing rectangles from

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int[][]
    checkForCheck(int[][] moves, int currentX, int currentY)
    function called within click() and checkGameEnd which removes any spaces that a piece could move to that would result in it being check
    void
    checkForPromotion()
    checks if any pawns have reached the end of the board by checking their endY
    int
    checkGameEnd(boolean turn)
    checks if the game is either stalemate or checkmate if the current player has no moves: if it is check, they lost by checkmate if it isn't, they have drawn by stalemate otherwise, just quickly check if there are only kings, in which case, stalemate
    void
    click(int squareX, int squareY)
    originally identified by the gamearena, passed to the input manager, passed to the gamemanager which identifies what square has been clicked now passed to the board with parameters identifying which square exactly was clicked, so it can identify what to do next clicking already selected square deselects it clicking a square with nothing on it does nothing clicking a square with a piece when it is its turn selects the square (if not already selected) clicking a square that is movable moves the piece selected there
    Square[][]
    getBoard()
    returns the board's playing board (array of squares)
    boolean
    isCheck(Square[][] board, boolean turn)
    checks all squares, looks at all possible moves for each piece
    boolean
    justKings()
    checks if there are only kings left on the board
    boolean
    movesEmpty(int[][] moves)
    searches through a given move 2d array for any value > 0, which means it can move there
    boolean
    noMoves(int colour)
    takes a tema colour and identifies if that team has any available moves scans all pieces on that team, then scans all their moves until finding one that is greater than 0, which means it can move
    void
    outputBoard(GameArena arena)
    outputs the board: adds every piece's balls and rectangles to the arena for display
    void
    outputMoves(int[][] moves)
     
    void
    resetBoard()
    resets all squares, making them not selected or movable
    void
    setGameArena(GameArena gameArena)
    sets the board's game arena for later reference
    void
    setGameManager(GameManager gameManager)
    sets the board's game manager for later reference

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(int squareWidth, int startPointX, int startPointY)
      constructor, takes the squarewidth and the coordinates of startpoints to start drawing rectangles from
      Parameters:
      squareWidth - squarewidth
      startPointX - rectangle startpoint x value
      startPointY - rectangle startpoint y value

  • Method Details

    • outputBoard

      public void outputBoard(GameArena arena)
      outputs the board: adds every piece's balls and rectangles to the arena for display
      Parameters:
      arena - arena to add to

    • outputMoves

      public void outputMoves(int[][] moves)

    • resetBoard

      public void resetBoard()
      resets all squares, making them not selected or movable

    • click

      public void click(int squareX, int squareY)
      originally identified by the gamearena, passed to the input manager, passed to the gamemanager which identifies what square has been clicked now passed to the board with parameters identifying which square exactly was clicked, so it can identify what to do next clicking already selected square deselects it clicking a square with nothing on it does nothing clicking a square with a piece when it is its turn selects the square (if not already selected) clicking a square that is movable moves the piece selected there
      Parameters:
      squareX - the square clicked X
      squareY - the square clicked Y

    • isCheck

      public boolean isCheck(Square[][] board, boolean turn)
      checks all squares, looks at all possible moves for each piece
      Parameters:
      board -
      Returns:

    • checkForCheck

      public int[][] checkForCheck(int[][] moves, int currentX, int currentY)
      function called within click() and checkGameEnd which removes any spaces that a piece could move to that would result in it being check
      Parameters:
      moves - the 2d array of integers that determines where a piece could move to
      currentX - x coordinate of the piece
      currentY - y coordinate of the piece
      Returns:
      the altered 2d array without any invalid moves

    • checkGameEnd

      public int checkGameEnd(boolean turn)
      checks if the game is either stalemate or checkmate if the current player has no moves: if it is check, they lost by checkmate if it isn't, they have drawn by stalemate otherwise, just quickly check if there are only kings, in which case, stalemate
      Parameters:
      turn - whose turn it is
      Returns:
      the game status- 0: fine, 1: checkmate, 2: stalemate

    • justKings

      public boolean justKings()
      checks if there are only kings left on the board
      Returns:
      true or false

    • noMoves

      public boolean noMoves(int colour)
      takes a tema colour and identifies if that team has any available moves scans all pieces on that team, then scans all their moves until finding one that is greater than 0, which means it can move
      Parameters:
      colour - colour of team whose turn it is
      Returns:
      true or false- true means no moves, false means moves

    • movesEmpty

      public boolean movesEmpty(int[][] moves)
      searches through a given move 2d array for any value > 0, which means it can move there
      Parameters:
      moves -
      Returns:

    • checkForPromotion

      public void checkForPromotion()
      checks if any pawns have reached the end of the board by checking their endY

    • setGameManager

      public void setGameManager(GameManager gameManager)
      sets the board's game manager for later reference
      Parameters:
      gameManager -

    • setGameArena

      public void setGameArena(GameArena gameArena)
      sets the board's game arena for later reference
      Parameters:
      gameArena -

    • getBoard

      public Square[][] getBoard()
      returns the board's playing board (array of squares)
